channel.title: Java question
channel.description:
I don't ask for help how to use Java on the private server by editing your game and let it functioning it bether no i just wanne ask where to learn it or where to get started step by step by beginning to open a java program >.< coz i never worked with it :) my apologies if it sounds kinda stupid but its bether by asking how to work with it then getting a personal help with it :) greetz Attax
EDIT: afcours its indeed appreciated to tell a place where to learn but also give some advice where to start for me it doesnt realy matther how you explain it, it only minds that it is understandable to starters :rolleyes:

item.title: Java question
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Ollie:

frank_ has the best idea, maybe read the first few basic chapters on the internet for java and once you understand briefly how it works just try making example programs.

that’s how i learned…
And the ONLY thing i learned from SG was how to use the scanner object

if i ever need to learn how to use an object, i always look up its javadoc first…

Read full topic

item.title: Java question
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Just get a good book and start reading. May I recommend Java Swing? Then just get a book about beginning java. Remember, o’reilly ftw.

Read full topic

item.title: Java question
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

sean greasly is ok if you can stand his bad habits and small errors

I must say that I learnt by example, back in the days of RSC bots, just inspecting code to see how it all works

Read full topic

item.title: Java question
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Take a look at these posts:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

It depends on your learning style really…I like learning the basics and then just diving in, experimenting with the language and reading articles on it in the process. Others like reading full books on the subject…but a lot of people say seangreasley.com has good video tutorials (never bothered to watch them myself), so you might want to look at that too

Read full topic
